definition: to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent

sentences.english: Jordan's Tzu Chi organization once again travel to the Wadi Abdoun district to bring hot food to the tent city.
sentences.chinese: 約旦慈濟志工前往窪地阿頓地區，爲居民帶來熱食。

sentences.english: I would refuse to eat any hot food or beverages in plastic containers.
sentences.chinese: 或我會拒食任何裝在塑膠內的燙熱食物。

sentences.english: Besieged between the state of Chen and Cai, Confucius and his disciples had not cooked for seven days.
sentences.chinese: 孔子一行人被圍困在陳蔡之間已經七天沒有喫熱食了。

sentences.english: They haven't eaten hot food for many days.
sentences.chinese: 他們已經好幾天沒喫到熱食了。

sentences.english: In the hot kitchen quantities have been set at 100 persons (max).
sentences.chinese: 在熱食方面，規定的烹煮數量爲最多一百人份。

sentences.english: The Honey Mustard Fruits can be served cold or warm.
sentences.chinese: 芥末果肉蜂蜜即可冷食也可熱食。

sentences.english: They go into the house with her. There is hot food waiting on a table.
sentences.chinese: 他們和她一起走進屋裏，桌上已經擺好了熱食。

sentences.english: Lastly put in sago , continue to simmer for about another 5 minutes. Serve hot or cold with coconut milk.
sentences.chinese: 最後加入西米，續煲約5分鐘，可伴以椰汁凍或熱食。

sentences.english: If you buy ready-to-eat, hot food, make sure it's served steaming hot.
sentences.chinese: 如果你買現成的喫，熱食，確保它的服務熱氣騰騰。

sentences.english: You can use a slow cooker to keep the hot foods hot.
sentences.chinese: 你可以用一個慢火爐來保持熱食物的熱度。

sentences.english: It tastes good either served hot or cold.
The number of males who reported that they cooked reheat food thoroughly most of the time was 198.
sentences.chinese: 報稱經常會徹底煮熟或翻熱食物的男性人數是198。

definition: variant of 熱乎乎|热乎乎[re4 hu1 hu1]
farmer's cooperative/abbr. for 農民協會|农民协会
